   20: 
   21: -module(base64_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: %% Test server specific exports
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, group/1]).
   27: 
   28: %% Test cases must be exported.
   29: -export([base64_encode/1, base64_encode_to_string/1, base64_encode_modes/1,
   30: 	 base64_decode/1, base64_decode_to_string/1, base64_decode_modes/1,
   31: 	 base64_otp_5635/1, base64_otp_6279/1, big/1, illegal/1,
   32: 	 mime_decode/1, mime_decode_modes/1,
   33: 	 mime_decode_to_string/1, mime_decode_to_string_modes/1,
   34: 	 roundtrip_1/1, roundtrip_2/1, roundtrip_3/1, roundtrip_4/1]).
   35: 
   36: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   37: %% Test cases starts here.
   38: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   39: 
   40: suite() ->
   41:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   42:      {timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
   43: 
   44: all() ->
   45:     [base64_encode, base64_encode_to_string, base64_encode_modes,
   46:      base64_decode, base64_decode_to_string, base64_decode_modes,
   47:      base64_otp_5635, base64_otp_6279, big, illegal,
   48:      mime_decode, mime_decode_modes,
   49:      mime_decode_to_string, mime_decode_to_string_modes,
   50:      {group, roundtrip}].
   51: 
   52: groups() ->
   53:     [{roundtrip, [parallel],
   54:       [roundtrip_1, roundtrip_2, roundtrip_3, roundtrip_4]}].
   55: 
   56: group(roundtrip) ->
   57:     %% valgrind needs a lot of time
   58:     [{timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   59: 
   60: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   61: %% Test base64:encode/1,2.
   62: base64_encode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   63:     %% Two pads
   64:     <<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">> =
   65: 	base64:encode("Aladdin:open sesame"),
   66:     <<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ">> =
   67:         base64:encode("Aladdin:open sesame", #{padding => false}),
   68:     %% One pad
   69:     <<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=">> = base64:encode(<<"Hello World">>),
   70:     <<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ">> = base64:encode(<<"Hello World">>, #{padding => false}),
   71:     %% No pad
   72:     <<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft">> = base64:encode("Aladdin:open sesam"),
   73:     <<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft">> =
   74:         base64:encode("Aladdin:open sesam", #{padding => false}),
   75: 
   76:     <<"MDEyMzQ1Njc4OSFAIzBeJiooKTs6PD4sLiBbXXt9">> =
   77: 	base64:encode(<<"0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}">>),
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   81: %% Test base64:encode_to_string/1,2.
   82: base64_encode_to_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   83:     %% Two pads
   84:     "QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==" =
   85:         base64:encode_to_string("Aladdin:open sesame"),
   86:     "QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ" =
   87:         base64:encode_to_string("Aladdin:open sesame", #{padding => false}),
   88:     %% One pad
   89:     "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=" = base64:encode_to_string(<<"Hello World">>),
   90:     "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ" =
   91:         base64:encode_to_string(<<"Hello World">>, #{padding => false}),
   92:     %% No pad
   93:     "QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft" =
   94: 	base64:encode_to_string("Aladdin:open sesam"),
   95:     "QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft" =
   96:         base64:encode_to_string("Aladdin:open sesam", #{padding => false}),
   97: 
   98:     "MDEyMzQ1Njc4OSFAIzBeJiooKTs6PD4sLiBbXXt9" =
   99: 	base64:encode_to_string(<<"0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}">>),
  100:     ok.
  101: 
  102: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  103: %% Test base64:encode/2 and base64:encode_to_string/2.
  104: base64_encode_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  105:     Data = <<23, 234, 63, 163, 239, 129, 253, 175, 171>>,
  106: 
  107:     <<"F+o/o++B/a+r">> = base64:encode(Data, #{mode => standard}),
  108:     <<"F-o_o--B_a-r">> = base64:encode(Data, #{mode => urlsafe}),
  109: 
  110:     "F+o/o++B/a+r" = base64:encode_to_string(Data, #{mode => standard}),
  111:     "F-o_o--B_a-r" = base64:encode_to_string(Data, #{mode => urlsafe}),
  112: 
  113:     ok.
  114: 
  115: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  116: %% Test base64:decode/1,2.
  117: base64_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  118:     %% Two pads
  119:     <<"Aladdin:open sesame">> =
  120:         base64:decode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">>),
  121:     <<"Aladdin:open sesame">> =
  122:         base64:decode("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ=="),
  123:     <<"Aladdin:open sesame">> =
  124:         base64:decode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ">>, #{padding => false}),
  125:     <<"Aladdin:open sesame">> =
  126:         base64:decode("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ", #{padding => false}),
  127:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  128:         catch base64:decode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ">>),
  129:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  130:         catch base64:decode("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ"),
  131:     %% One pad
  132:     <<"Hello World">> = base64:decode(<<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=">>),
  133:     <<"Hello World">> = base64:decode("SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ="),
  134:     <<"Hello World">> = base64:decode(<<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ">>, #{padding => false}),
  135:     <<"Hello World">> = base64:decode("SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ", #{padding => false}),
  136:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  137:         catch base64:decode_to_string(<<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ">>),
  138:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  139:         catch base64:decode_to_string("SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ"),
  140:     %% No pad
  141:     <<"Aladdin:open sesam">> =
  142:         base64:decode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft">>),
  143:     <<"Aladdin:open sesam">> =
  144:         base64:decode("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft"),
  145:     <<"Aladdin:open sesam">> =
  146:         base64:decode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft">>, #{padding => false}),
  147:     <<"Aladdin:open sesam">> =
  148:         base64:decode("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft", #{padding => false}),
  149: 
  150:     Alphabet = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),
  151:     Alphabet = base64:decode(base64:encode(Alphabet)),
  152:     Alphabet = base64:decode(base64:encode_to_string(Alphabet)),
  153: 
  154:     %% Encoded base 64 strings may be divided by non base 64 chars.
  155:     %% In this cases whitespaces.
  156:     <<"0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}">> =
  157:         base64:decode(
  158:             "MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \niooKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9"),
  159:     <<"0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}">> =
  160:         base64:decode(
  161:             <<"MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \niooKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9">>),
  162:     ok.
  163: 
  164: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  165: %% Test base64:decode_to_string/1,2.
  166: base64_decode_to_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  167:     %% Two pads
  168:     "Aladdin:open sesame" =
  169:         base64:decode_to_string(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">>),
  170:     "Aladdin:open sesame" =
  171:         base64:decode_to_string("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ=="),
  172:     "Aladdin:open sesame" =
  173:         base64:decode_to_string(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ">>, #{padding => false}),
  174:     "Aladdin:open sesame" =
  175:         base64:decode_to_string("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ", #{padding => false}),
  176:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  177:         catch base64:decode_to_string(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ">>),
  178:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  179:         catch base64:decode_to_string("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ"),
  180:     %% One pad
  181:     "Hello World" = base64:decode_to_string(<<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=">>),
  182:     "Hello World" = base64:decode_to_string("SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ="),
  183:     "Hello World" = base64:decode_to_string(<<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ">>, #{padding => false}),
  184:     "Hello World" = base64:decode_to_string("SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ", #{padding => false}),
  185:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  186:         catch base64:decode_to_string(<<"SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ">>),
  187:     {'EXIT', {'missing_padding', _}} =
  188:         catch base64:decode_to_string("SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ"),
  189:     %% No pad
  190:     "Aladdin:open sesam" =
  191:         base64:decode_to_string(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft">>),
  192:     "Aladdin:open sesam" =
  193:         base64:decode_to_string("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft"),
  194:     "Aladdin:open sesam" =
  195:         base64:decode_to_string(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft">>, #{padding => false}),
  196:     "Aladdin:open sesam" =
  197:         base64:decode_to_string("QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2Ft", #{padding => false}),
  198: 
  199:     Alphabet = lists:seq(0, 255),
  200:     Alphabet = base64:decode_to_string(base64:encode(Alphabet)),
  201:     Alphabet = base64:decode_to_string(base64:encode_to_string(Alphabet)),
  202: 
  203:     %% Encoded base 64 strings may be divided by non base 64 chars.
  204:     %% In this cases whitespaces.
  205:     "0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}" =
  206:         base64:decode_to_string(
  207:             "MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \niooKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9"),
  208:     "0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}" =
  209:         base64:decode_to_string(
  210:             <<"MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \niooKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9">>),
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  214: %% Test base64:decode/2 and base64:decode_to_string/2
  215: base64_decode_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  216:     DataBin = <<23, 234, 63, 163, 239, 129, 253, 175, 171>>,
  217:     DataStr = [23, 234, 63, 163, 239, 129, 253, 175, 171],
  218: 
  219:     DataBin = base64:decode("F+o/o++B/a+r", #{mode => standard}),
  220:     DataBin = base64:decode("F-o_o--B_a-r", #{mode => urlsafe}),
  221:     {'EXIT', _} = catch base64:decode("F-o_o--B_a-r", #{mode => standard}),
  222:     {'EXIT', _} = catch base64:decode("F+o/o++B/a+r", #{mode => urlsafe}),
  223: 
  224:     DataStr = base64:decode_to_string("F+o/o++B/a+r", #{mode => standard}),
  225:     DataStr = base64:decode_to_string("F-o_o--B_a-r", #{mode => urlsafe}),
  226:     {'EXIT', _} = catch base64:decode_to_string("F-o_o--B_a-r", #{mode => standard}),
  227:     {'EXIT', _} = catch base64:decode_to_string("F+o/o++B/a+r", #{mode => urlsafe}),
  228: 
  229:     ok.
  230: 
  231: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  232: %% OTP-5635: Some data doesn't pass through base64:decode/1 correctly.
  233: base64_otp_5635(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  234:     <<"===">> = base64:decode(base64:encode("===")),
  235:     ok.
  236: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: %% OTP-6279: Make sure illegal characters are rejected when decoding.
  238: base64_otp_6279(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode("dGVzda==a")),
  240:     ok.
  241: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  242: %% Encode and decode big binaries.
  243: big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  244:     Big = make_big_binary(300000),
  245:     B = base64:encode(Big),
  246:     true = is_binary(B),
  247:     400000 = byte_size(B),
  248:     Big = base64:decode(B),
  249:     Big = base64:mime_decode(B),
  250:     ok.
  251: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  252: %% Make sure illegal characters are rejected when decoding.
  253: illegal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     %% A few samples with different error reasons. Nothing can be
  255:     %% assumed about the reason for the crash.
  256:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode("()")),
  257:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode(<<19:8,20:8,21:8,22:8>>)),
  258:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode([19,20,21,22])),
  259:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode_to_string(<<19:8,20:8,21:8,22:8>>)),
  260:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch base64:decode_to_string([19,20,21,22])),
  261:     ok.
  262: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  263: %% mime_decode and mime_decode_to_string have different implementations
  264: %% so test both with the same input separately.
  265: %%
  266: %% Test base64:mime_decode/1.
  267: mime_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  268:     MimeDecode = fun(In) ->
  269:                          Out = base64:mime_decode(In),
  270:                          Out = base64:mime_decode(binary_to_list(In))
  271:                  end,
  272:     %% Test correct padding
  273:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b25l">>),
  274:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b24=">>),
  275:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw==">>),
  276:     %% Test 1 extra padding
  277:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b25l= =">>),
  278:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b24== =">>),
  279:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw=== =">>),
  280:     %% Test 2 extra padding
  281:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b25l===">>),
  282:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b24====">>),
  283:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw=====">>),
  284:     %% Test misc embedded padding
  285:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<"b2=5l===">>),
  286:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"b=24====">>),
  287:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"b=w=====">>),
  288:     %% Test misc white space and illegals with embedded padding
  289:     <<"one">> = MimeDecode(<<" b~2=\r\n5()l===">>),
  290:     <<"on">>  = MimeDecode(<<"\tb =2\"¤4=¤=   ==">>),
  291:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"\nb=w=====">>),
  292:     %% Two pads
  293:     <<"Aladdin:open sesame">> =
  294: 	MimeDecode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvc()GVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">>),
  295:     %% One pad to ignore, followed by more text
  296:     <<"Hello World!!">> = MimeDecode(<<"SGVsb)(G8gV29ybGQ=h IQ= =">>),
  297:     %% No pad
  298:     <<"Aladdin:open sesam">> =
  299: 	MimeDecode(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcG¤\")(VuIHNlc2Ft">>),
  300:     %% Encoded base 64 strings may be divided by non base 64 chars.
  301:     %% In this cases whitespaces.
  302:     <<"0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}">> =
  303: 	MimeDecode(
  304: 	  <<"MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \nio)(oKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9">>),
  305:     %% Zeroes
  306:     <<"012">> = MimeDecode(<<"\000M\000D\000E\000y=\000">>),
  307:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw==\000">>),
  308:     <<"o">>   = MimeDecode(<<"bw=\000=">>),
  309:     ok.
  310: 
  311: %% Test base64:mime_decode/2.
  312: mime_decode_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  313:     MimeDecode = fun (In, Options) ->
  314:                                 Out = base64:mime_decode(In, Options),
  315:                                 Out = base64:mime_decode(binary_to_list(In), Options)
  316:                  end,
  317: 
  318:     %% The following all decode to the same data.
  319:     Data = <<23, 234, 63, 163, 239, 129, 253, 175, 171>>,
  320:     Data = MimeDecode(<<"F+o/o++B/a+r">>, #{mode => standard}),
  321:     Data = MimeDecode(<<"F-o_o--B_a-r">>, #{mode => urlsafe}),
  322: 
  323:     %% The following decodes to different data depending on mode.
  324:     Base64 = <<"AB+C+D/E/FG-H-I_J_KL">>,
  325:     %% In standard mode, "-" and "_" are invalid and thus ignored.
  326:     %% The base64 string to be decoded is equivalent to "AB+C+D/E/FGHIJKL".
  327:     <<0, 31, 130, 248, 63, 196, 252, 81, 135, 32, 146, 139>> =
  328:         MimeDecode(Base64, #{mode => standard}),
  329:     %% In urlsafe mode, "+" and "/" are invalid and thus ignored.
  330:     %% The base64 string to be decoded is equivalent to "ABCDEFG-H-I_J_KL".
  331:     <<0, 16, 131, 16, 81, 190, 31, 226, 63, 39, 242, 139>> =
  332:         MimeDecode(Base64, #{mode => urlsafe}),
  333: 
  334:     ok.
  335: 
  336: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  337: 
  338: %% Repeat of mime_decode() tests
  339: 
  340: %% Test base64:mime_decode_to_string/1.
  341: mime_decode_to_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  342:     MimeDecodeToString =
  343:         fun(In) ->
  344:                 Out = base64:mime_decode_to_string(In),
  345:                 Out = base64:mime_decode_to_string(binary_to_list(In))
  346:         end,
  347:     %% Test correct padding
  348:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b25l">>),
  349:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b24=">>),
  350:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw==">>),
  351:     %% Test 1 extra padding
  352:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b25l= =">>),
  353:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b24== =">>),
  354:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw=== =">>),
  355:     %% Test 2 extra padding
  356:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b25l===">>),
  357:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b24====">>),
  358:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw=====">>),
  359:     %% Test misc embedded padding
  360:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b2=5l===">>),
  361:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b=24====">>),
  362:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"b=w=====">>),
  363:     %% Test misc white space and illegals with embedded padding
  364:     "one" = MimeDecodeToString(<<" b~2=\r\n5()l===">>),
  365:     "on"  = MimeDecodeToString(<<"\tb =2\"¤4=¤=   ==">>),
  366:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"\nb=w=====">>),
  367:     %% Two pads
  368:     "Aladdin:open sesame" =
  369: 	MimeDecodeToString(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvc()GVuIHNlc2FtZQ==">>),
  370:     %% One pad to ignore, followed by more text
  371:     "Hello World!!" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"SGVsb)(G8gV29ybGQ=h IQ= =">>),
  372:     %% No pad
  373:     "Aladdin:open sesam" =
  374: 	MimeDecodeToString(<<"QWxhZGRpbjpvcG¤\")(VuIHNlc2Ft">>),
  375:     %% Encoded base 64 strings may be divided by non base 64 chars.
  376:     %% In this cases whitespaces.
  377:     "0123456789!@#0^&*();:<>,. []{}" =
  378: 	MimeDecodeToString(
  379: 	  <<"MDEy MzQ1Njc4 \tOSFAIzBeJ \nio)(oKTs6 PD4sLi \r\nBbXXt9">>),
  380:     %% Zeroes
  381:     "012" = MimeDecodeToString(<<"\000M\000D\000E\000y=\000">>),
  382:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw==\000">>),
  383:     "o"   = MimeDecodeToString(<<"bw=\000=">>),
  384:     ok.
  385: 
  386: 
  387: %% Test base64:mime_decode_to_string/2.
  388: mime_decode_to_string_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  389:     MimeDecode = fun (In, Options) ->
  390:                                 Out = base64:mime_decode_to_string(In, Options),
  391:                                 Out = base64:mime_decode_to_string(binary_to_list(In), Options)
  392:                  end,
  393: 
  394:     %% The following all decode to the same data.
  395:     Data = [23, 234, 63, 163, 239, 129, 253, 175, 171],
  396:     Data = MimeDecode(<<"F+o/o++B/a+r">>, #{mode => standard}),
  397:     Data = MimeDecode(<<"F-o_o--B_a-r">>, #{mode => urlsafe}),
  398: 
  399:     %% The following decodes to different data depending on mode.
  400:     Base64 = <<"AB+C+D/E/FG-H-I_J_KL">>,
  401:     %% In standard mode, "-" and "_" are invalid and thus ignored.
  402:     %% The base64 string to be decoded is equivalent to "AB+C+D/E/FGHIJKL".
  403:     [0, 31, 130, 248, 63, 196, 252, 81, 135, 32, 146, 139] =
  404:         MimeDecode(Base64, #{mode => standard}),
  405:     %% In urlsafe mode, "+" and "/" are invalid and thus ignored.
  406:     %% The base64 string to be decoded is equivalent to "ABCDEFG-H-I_J_KL".
  407:     [0, 16, 131, 16, 81, 190, 31, 226, 63, 39, 242, 139] =
  408:         MimeDecode(Base64, #{mode => urlsafe}),
  409: 
  410:     ok.
  411: 
  412: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  413: 
  414: roundtrip_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  415:     do_roundtrip(1).
  416: 
  417: roundtrip_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  418:     do_roundtrip(2).
  419: 
  420: roundtrip_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  421:     do_roundtrip(3).
  422: 
  423: roundtrip_4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  424:     do_roundtrip(4).
  425: 
  426: do_roundtrip(Offset) ->
  427:     Sizes = lists:seq(Offset, 255, 4) ++ lists:seq(2400-6+Offset, 2440, 4),
  428:     do_roundtrip_1(Sizes, []).
  429: 
  430: do_roundtrip_1([NextSize|Sizes], Current) ->
  431:     Len = length(Current),
  432:     io:format("~p", [Len]),
  433:     do_roundtrip_2(Current),
  434:     Next = random_byte_list(NextSize - Len, Current),
  435:     do_roundtrip_1(Sizes, Next);
  436: do_roundtrip_1([], Last) ->
  437:     io:format("~p", [length(Last)]),
  438:     do_roundtrip_2(Last).
  439: 
  440: do_roundtrip_2(List) ->
  441:     Bin = list_to_binary(List),
  442:     Base64Bin = base64:encode(List),
  443:     Base64Bin = base64:encode(Bin),
  444:     Base64List = base64:encode_to_string(List),
  445:     Base64Bin = list_to_binary(Base64List),
  446:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  447:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  448:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  449:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  450:     append_roundtrip(8, Bin, List, Base64Bin),
  451:     prepend_roundtrip(8, Bin, List, Base64List),
  452:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip(Bin, List, Base64List).
  453: 
  454: append_roundtrip(0, _, _, _) -> ok;
  455: append_roundtrip(N, Bin, List, Base64Bin0) ->
  456:     Base64Bin = <<Base64Bin0/binary,"\n">>,
  457:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  458:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  459:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  460:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  461: 
  462:     Base64List = binary_to_list(Base64Bin),
  463:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64List),
  464:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64List),
  465:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64List),
  466:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64List),
  467:     append_roundtrip(N-1, Bin, List, Base64Bin).
  468: 
  469: prepend_roundtrip(0, _, _, _) -> ok;
  470: prepend_roundtrip(N, Bin, List, Base64List0) ->
  471:     Base64List = [$\s|Base64List0],
  472:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64List),
  473:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64List),
  474:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64List),
  475:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64List),
  476: 
  477:     Base64Bin = list_to_binary(Base64List),
  478:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  479:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  480:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  481:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  482:     prepend_roundtrip(N-1, Bin, List, Base64List).
  483: 
  484: %% Do an exhaustive test of interleaving whitespace (for short strings).
  485: interleaved_ws_roundtrip(Bin, List, Base64List) when byte_size(Bin) =< 6 ->
  486:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(lists:reverse(Base64List), [], Bin, List);
  487: interleaved_ws_roundtrip(_, _, _) -> ok.
  488: 
  489: interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1([H|T], Tail, Bin, List) ->
  490:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H|Tail], Bin, List),
  491:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H,$\s|Tail], Bin, List),
  492:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H,$\s,$\t|Tail], Bin, List),
  493:     interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1(T, [H,$\n,$\t|Tail], Bin, List);
  494: interleaved_ws_roundtrip_1([], Base64List, Bin, List) ->
  495:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64List),
  496:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64List),
  497:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64List),
  498:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64List),
  499: 
  500:     Base64Bin = list_to_binary(Base64List),
  501:     Bin = base64:decode(Base64Bin),
  502:     List = base64:decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  503:     Bin = base64:mime_decode(Base64Bin),
  504:     List = base64:mime_decode_to_string(Base64Bin),
  505:     ok.
  506: 
  507: random_byte_list(0, Acc) ->
  508:     Acc;
  509: random_byte_list(N, Acc) ->
  510:     random_byte_list(N-1, [rand:uniform(255)|Acc]).
  511: 
  512: make_big_binary(N) ->
  513:     list_to_binary(mbb(N, [])).
  514: 
  515: mbb(N, Acc) when N > 256 ->
  516:     B = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),
  517:     mbb(N - 256, [B | Acc]);
  518: mbb(N, Acc) ->
  519:     B = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, N-1)),
  520:     lists:reverse(Acc, B).
